intro: Hofmeisteria urenifolia var. mexiae, commonly known as Mexican velvetleaf, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its soft, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and clustered, often with a pale yellow or greenish hue. It is known for its adaptability to various environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
